DataElement.preferredName: Patient Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable response regarding whether the patient meets the criteria to participate in a specific clinical trial based on any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person as an element of the personal medical history.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person as an element of the personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma of the bladder that is not amenable to curative surgical treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed (at original diagnosis or subsequent recurrence or progression) lymphoma, chronic lymphocytic lymphoma (CLL) or solid tumor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have histolo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed solid malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable for which standard curative or palliative treatments do not exist or are no longer effective?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients with known BRAFv600x mutation: Does patient have known BRAF-V600X mutated, histologically confirmed cancer that is metastatic or unresectable and for which curative or standard therapies do not exist or are no longer effective?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically documented solid tumors whose disease has progressed following at least one line of standard therapy and/or no standard of treatment exists that has been shown to prolong survival?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a histologically confirmed diagnosis of cancer and is being evaluated and/or treated for cancer at participating sites?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have histologically confirmed solid malignancy (excluding lymphoma) that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma of the bladder that is not amenable to curative surgical treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have stage IV or recurrent/metastatic histologically or cytologically confirmed non-squamous NSCLC?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed solid tumor malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable and for whom either standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective, or for whom anti-PD-L1/CTLA-4 is appropriate?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed solid tumor that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed non-squamous NSCLC, with incurable advanced or metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically proven metastatic or locally advanced tumors for which no standard therapy exists, or where standard therapy has failed, or in patients otherwise ineligible for standard therapy, or for an indication that anti-PD-1 therapy has been shown to be effective in studies in HIV-uninfected participants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Stage IV or recurrent/metastatic histologically confirmed non-squamous NSCLC?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or pathologically confirmed diagnosis of peripheral T-cell lymphoma (PTCL) follicular variant or angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma (AITL) as per World Health Organization (WHO) 2008 criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed, locally advanced or metastatic predominantly urothelial carcinoma of the bladder, ureter, or urethra that is not amenable to curative surgical treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have pathologically confirmed diagnosis of a solid tumor cancer for which there is no known standard therapy capable of extending life expectancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed relapsed/refractory ALK+ ALCL (with ALK positivity defined by immunohistochemistry and/or FISH/cytogenetics), MCL, or BCL6+ DLBCL (with BCL6 positivity defined by immunohistochemistry)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has primary oropharynx HNSCC, is disease HPV (-) according to local institutional definition using either p16 immunohistochemistry or HPV testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed, relapsed/refractory ALK+ ALCL (with ALK positivity defined by immunohistochemistry and/or FISH/cytogenetics), MCL, or BCL6+ DLBCL (with BCL6 positivity defined by immunohistochemistry from any prior biopsy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of cancer and is being evaluated and/or treated for cancer at participating sites?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed Alveolar Soft Part Sarcoma (ASPS) that is not curable by surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed locally advanced or metastatic Transitional Cell Carcinoma (TCC) which has progressed after standard therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed progressive, metastatic castration resistant prostate adenocarcinoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or pathologically confirmed malignancy (hematologic or solid tumor) that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard of care therapy does not exist or is no longer effective?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Stage IV or recurrent/metastatic histologically confirmed non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have invasive cancer in the contralateral breast?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has renal cell cancer associated with HLRCC, is disease metastatic and/or unresectable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have myelodysplastic syndrome/acute myeloid leukemia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have EHE that contains TAZ-CAMTA1 gene fusion as detected by fusion fluorescent in-situ hybridization (FISH) performed in a central reference laboratory at Cleveland Clinic?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does pateint have any of the following tumor types: melanoma, bone sarcomas, Soft tissue sarcomas, including angiosarcoma, primary cutaneous leiomyosarcoma, dermatofibrosarcoma protruberans, Leukemias, Myeloid sarcoma, leukemia cutis, and chloroma, Hodgkin's Lymphoma or B cell lymphoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed, gastric carcinoma, including GEJ adenocarcinoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known DPD deficiency?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in Phase II:  Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed small cell lung cancer whose disease has relapsed or progressed after greater than or equal to 1 prior therapy, one of which must have been a platinum doublet?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically documented solid tumors whose disease has progressed on standard therapy or for which there is no available standard therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed solid tumor malignancy that is metastatic or treatment refractory cancers which are not curable or do not have known palliative measures or treatments that are associated with a survival advantage (as defined by the subject or the physician Investigator)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient's disease recurrent or refractory to standard therapy or remaining treatment options are unlikely to be effective or patient refuses such therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any of the following tumor types: melanoma, bone sarcomas, Soft tissue sarcomas, including angiosarcoma, primary cutaneous leiomyosarcoma, dermatofibrosarcoma protruberans, Leukemias, Myeloid sarcoma, leukemia cutis, and chloroma, Hodgkin's Lymphoma or B cell lymphoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective or for whom CPT-11 treatment would be a viable therapy regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor malignancy with progression on at least one prior systemic therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed solid tumor malignancy that is metastatic or treatment refractory cancers which are not curable or do not have known measures or treatments that are associated with a survival advantage (as defined by the subject or the physician Investigator)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 44
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient in Cohort A, have histologically confirmed locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor malignancy, other than clear cell renal cell carcinoma with progression on at least one prior systemic therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 45
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed transformed diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL), including histologic transformation from any indolent lymphoma (e.g. follicular or marginal zone lymphoma) or Richter transformation of CLL/SLL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 47
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed locally advanced or metastatic Translational  Cell Carcinoma (TCC, also known as urothelial carcinoma)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 46
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the prostate?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 48
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically proven metastatic or locally advanced tumors for which no standard therapy exists, or where standard therapy has failed, or in patients otherwise ineligible for standard therapy, or for an indication that anti-PD-1 therapy has been shown to be effective in studies in HIV-uninfected participants, or does patient have  treatment-naïve Kaposi sarcoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 49
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histopathologically confirmed diagnosis of diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DBLCL) or primary mediastinal large B-cell lymphoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 50
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed malignancy that is radiologically evaluable and metastatic or unresectable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 51
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed melanoma, basal cell carcinoma, Merkel cell carcinoma, cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma, or MSI-high cancers for which standard non-immunological medical, surgical, or radiation therapy would be insufficient (i.e. Patients who are not surgical candidates)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 53
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have locally advanced and unresectable or metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 52
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 54
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed stage IIIB or IV NSCLC (squamous or nonsquamous) that is metastatic or unresectable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 55
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patients disease metastatic, unresectable, or for which a surgical approach would not likely confer a survival benefit or would be otherwise contraindicated in the opinion of the treating investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 56
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have recurrent, locally advanced, or metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -57
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed extensive stage SCLC (ES-SCLC) or other solid tumors for which carboplatin and etoposide are considered appropriate therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 58
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have locally advanced or metastatic disease that is not amenable to surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 59
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed neuroblastoma or osteosarcoma, verified at diagnosis or at relapse, that is recurrent or refractory and for which standard curative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 60
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically proven selected virus-associated tumors that are systemic, metastatic or locally advanced and not amenable to curative treatment options or are relapsed/refractory to first-line therapy as appropriate for each tumor type?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Histologically confirmed cutaneous or visceral angiosarcoma, where curative treatment is either not possible or curative modality therapy is declined by the subject

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 62
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have hypercalcemia greater than Grade 1 of the CTCAE v5 that is not corrected prior to treatment initiation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -61
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of histologically or cytologically confirmed NBL or osteosarcoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have node-positive unresectable or metastatic malignancy as described in 3.1.2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: URCC22053
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a history of hypercalcemia or vitamin D toxicity/sensitivity.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -62
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed non-uveal melanoma, basal cell carcinoma, Merkel cell carcinoma, or cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma for which standard non-immunological medical, surgical, or radiation therapy would be insufficient (i.e., patients who are not surgical candidates)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 63
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's clinical presentation consistent with, or has the patient been diagnosed with one of the following:  Stage IV colorectal cancer (CRC), Stage III/IV non-small cell (NSCL) OR small cell lung cancer (SCLC), metastatic prostate cancer (PCA), Stage IV gastric cancer, Stage IV esophageal cancer, Stage IV gastroesophageal junction cancer, Stage III/IV high grade serous ovarian cancer (OC), Stage III/IV invasive breast cancer (BRCA), Stage III/IV melanoma (MEL), acute myeloid leukemia (AML) or multiple myeloma (MML)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 64
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable with participation in this clinical trial determined to be the best option for next treatment in the opinion of the investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 65
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed DLBCL, NOS, high-grade B-cell lymphoma, or transformed indolent lymphoma as per the World Health Organization 2022 criteria?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.9 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002718. ak 2023.6.27 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002556. ak 2/16/23 added AQT for URMC ticket number CADSR0002058 cjl; 7/20/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQTs.wz
